text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today 
we are making the ultimate Thai Street food

okay this stuff it's cheap it's everywhere 
on the street it's a very popular grab and

go kind of breakfast but most importantly it's 
the best thing I've ever had on a stick so we

are making moo ping moo is Pork and ping means to 
grill so it's simply just grilled pork skewers

but it's the marinade that's totally going to 
blow you away so here is what you will need

so for the marinade you can blend everything 
in a blender if you want but I'm going to do

it old-school so we're going to start with garlic 
and cilantro roots all the peppercorns pound that

into a very very fine paste it's not as fine as 
I'd like it to be just yet but I'm going to add

my sugar palm sugar and pound it until the sugar 
is dissolved and it's completely completely fine

so now it's quite fine all the sugar and 
everything is quite fine okay it's going

to be wet just because the sugar has dissolved 
and then we're going to use this as our mixing

bowl and just add all the other ingredients in 
our oyster sauce black soy sauce black soy sauce

I've used in several different things but it's 
not a very salty sauce it's you it's a little

bit sweet a little bit salty but mostly it's to 
give a really nice dark color for our pork so I

saw a little bit of oil to help lubricate and 
distribute all that dissolve all that flavor

molecules coconut milk it's gonna add nice flavor 
and richness and also some water so this is going

to be kind of like in a way it's like a half 
marinate a half brine so the pork acid marinades

it'll absorb all that liquid and become plump 
and juicy and when you go to grill it it won't

dry out so just give it a good stir and then 
we're just going to set it aside until we're

ready to use it so the kind of pork that I prefer 
for this is pork collar but which is kind of like

the back of their neck because it's got really 
nice flavor and it's got lots of fat which is

what we need when we go to to skewer and Grill 
it because it's a very dry heat treatment that

these things are going to get so if you use really 
lean pork like pork loin or tenderloin it's gonna

it's not going to be juicy it's going to be dry 
so you when you look you want to find first the

direction of the Grainne you make sure you make 
the slices against the direction of the grain

so all our pork is cut and now we are just going 
to pour our marinade all over its yeah gosh this

is like a worker okay and then you want to give 
it a really a really really good stir so once

it's all mixed in you want to let it marinate in 
the fridge overnight or at least eight hours so

if you do it in the morning you can skewer them 
at nighttime if you want if you're in a rush and

you didn't planned ahead of time minimum minimum 
of three hours okay you really want to give time

for the marinade and the liquid in the marinade 
particularly to fully penetrate the pork plump

it up juice it up and the flavor can go all the 
way through the piece of the pork and not just

the outside okay so a little planning ahead will 
do you good okay so the pork has been marinating

and now it's time to skewer them so the skewers 
very important that you soak them overnight in

water so when you go to grill them they don't burn 
on you and break so so I usually just soak them at

the same time as when I start doing the port okay 
so before the apps before we skewer we're going to

add a little bit of cornstarch you can also use 
tapioca starch and the reason why we're doing

that is because the cornstarch will act like a 
very thin almost invisible batter okay so we go

to cook it the cornstarch will create a seal that 
helps prevent the pork from being dry and create a

really nice mouthfeel I've done this before in one 
of the videos using the same technique my dad not

videos if some of you remember where use tapioca 
starch in the pork marinade before we drop the

pork into the soft the same thing the starch seals 
the pork and keep it moist and tender trust me it

makes quite a difference so now that we've got to 
make stuff whoo whoo it's cold we're gonna skewer

so once you've got one skewer you want to lay 
it flat on a tray and lay it so that the pieces

are sort of like laying on top of each other 
like this and then when we go to to grill it

would be is there one nice long piece if you 
do that so same thing with our next skewer and

then you want to keep going and pack them 
so they're really tight next to each other

and that will help sort of shape the skewer 
so they're nice and uniform in shape and at

this point you can grill them right away but I 
find that the skewers end up looking a little

nicer if you let them sit on the tray pack like 
this for several more hours because sort of you

know you put it in the fridge it cools down the 
cornstarch has time to absorb all that liquid

and hold the pieces so when you go to grill the 
pieces are not flopping and flipping everywhere

so my timeline for this this might be useful for 
you is I start marinating in the morning okay of

the day before I want to use it at night before I 
go to bed I have had all day to marinate I skewer

them and then I let them sit in the fridge on the 
skewer so they have time to set and then the next

day all I have to do is grill them so that time 
line really works for me it might work for you

as well so I'm just going to keep going so it's 
grilling time it's a cold dish today but that's

okay we're going to make it work medium high to 
medium heat these are very thin but depends on

your barbecue if it's a weak barbecue crank 
it out if it's a strong barbecue you don't

want to go too high cuz there's sugar in the 
marinade so it can burn easily so off we go

so we're about to eat this but always always 
always surf moving with some sticky rice I've

got two different videos with three different 
ways that show you how to make your own sticky

rice you can go check that out and choose 
your preferred method and let's eat mmm

salty a little sweet so tender and so juicy oh 
yeah you have to try this and when you do let

me know how it goes either through facebook 
twitter or instagram if you enjoy the show

please click to subscribe and I will see you 
next time oh yes recipe you know where the

recipe is hot I am calm and I will see you 
next time for your next delicious Thai meal
